definition: exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb

sentences.english: Olivia, so neat in all she'd do.
sentences.chinese: 奥莉薇雅做什么都是干净整洁的。

sentences.english: We can keep our hair tidy with a comb.
sentences.chinese: 我们能用梳子来保持头发的整洁。

sentences.english: Neck medium in length, clean and strong, not throaty.
sentences.chinese: 颈部中等长度，整洁且结实，无吊喉。

sentences.english: We can play well in a tidy room.
sentences.chinese: 在一个整洁的房间里我们会做的更好。

sentences.english: After finishing fax, please take back documents promptly and keep the desk clean.
sentences.chinese: 大家发完传真后，请及时收回文件，并保持桌面整洁。

sentences.english: As a qualified soldier, you must keep your uniform tidy and have powerful posture.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个合格的军人，必须仪表整洁军姿威武。

sentences.english: For all these noble reasons and more, sloppy people never get neat.
sentences.chinese: 因为所有这些高贵之处，邋遢的人从来就没有整洁过。

sentences.english: Deserts were tidy, because there were no weeds in them, nothing that crawled.
sentences.chinese: 沙漠很整洁，因为里面没有杂草，没有爬行的东西。

sentences.english: This fits in with the larger Japanese attitude of neatness and order.
sentences.chinese: 这和日本人更广泛的整洁观和秩序观倒是很搭配。

sentences.english: Children must learn to write neatly.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们必须学会整洁地写字。

sentences.english: The first-rate wife is virtuous and keeps a neat home.
sentences.chinese: 一等太太，治家整洁，贤慧有德。

sentences.english: Completely closed spray developing process, make the cleaning workshop clean and day.
sentences.chinese: 机器完全密闭喷淋显影，保持车间地面干燥，整洁。

sentences.english: Tolerate no uncleanliness ni body, clothes, or habitation.
sentences.chinese: 身体，衣物和住所都应保持整洁。

sentences.english: The boy was at loggerheads with his parents over his long hair and untidy clothes.
sentences.chinese: 男孩和他的父母因长发和不整洁的衣着吵了起来。

sentences.english: Beth Holland is president of Neatness Courts, a home organization company.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝是整洁庭院的会长，它是一个组织公司。

definition: untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom); selfless and incorruptible/spotless
lit. clear window and clean table (idiom)/fig. bright and clean
according to a pattern/regular/orderly/structured/neat and tidy
to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
everything clear and in good order (idiom); neat and tidy
everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
